text: Wow this sounds really badass. I would love a cover of this done.
author: VictorVonFox

text: What a shame Tim Follin had to compose music for games that were largely average. I mean, Konami and Capcom made excellent games with excellent music. Software Creations made games ranging from crappy to half-decent, with excellent music.
author: Daytime Sky

text: Thats largely why he left the industry all together he would work so hard to make music for these games only to have them be shit or be shelved all together. According to him it was exhausting and made him sick. Thats a shame how many composers were treated like this back then.
author: fffkey

text: @Kendall Littlejohn I wonder if Tommy Tallarico felt that way.
author: KesorodaBlk

text: @Daytime Sky Software creations made some really great games like Solstice and Equinox, both with Follin music. Too bad he had to do soundtracks for less glorious budget games later on consoles like the PS2 and Xbox, so it's kinda understandable he stopped making music for games.
author: CarozQH

text: pretty impressive for way back when

text:
Man that Beginning always gets me when it completely switches tone

author: fffkey

text: An awesome prog rock theme for the game's title screen. I like the calmer section at the end, a technique Tim Follin used quite a often. It always makes me want to hit the Play button again for another round.

text: @SupraDarky Rock theme? What are you talking abouTHAT'S THE SECOND TIME HE'S PULLED THAT!
